column4: is there any one that would be will to help answer some basic questions for a begginer getting into ubuntu?
just ask and see
get virtualbox and try it out in there... thats the 'safest' way to experiment
the website has a manual yes...
get the ubuntu iso, install virtualbox, run it.. follow its wizard dialogs I belive is  the core of it.
differnt desktop. KDE vs Gnome
the login screen has a menu under the 'gear' next to the login box.
and yes. Ubuntu uses gnome. unity is a shell on top of gnome-3
ubuntu.com perhaps.. askubuntu.com   various blog sites have guides.
its for everything from embeded controllers/watches/phones to high end servers :) and toasters..
haha yeah i am seeing that...thats why im learning about it and what i can do with it. seems a little bit useful.
keep an eye on this new hardware for a cool portable linux system -> http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/11/cotton-candy-the-usb-sized-arm-pc-that-runs-ubuntu/
hmmm, looking at that right now.
with unity, you can use win+a # (1through 9) to go to that app.. the # appears in the unity panel icons.
if using unity - must read links --> http://askubuntu.com/questions/36274/tips-and-tricks-for-unity
thank you. reading. i thought i saw a welcome to ubuntu that gave some tips built in but i cant find it now =(
that mini computer that you linked, the cotton candy usb thing, looks pretty sweet!
that rasberypi one is a similer idea. but cheaper. :)
haha i asked to many questions and got to many links. havent got to that one yet
depends on what windowmanager/desktop you are using
you would set up one to handle the grub. and   it should work.  - i dont see the point in having 2 differnt ubuntu versions on teh same flash.
so a live install? or a full install? you can set grub2 up to boot differnt ISO files - if you wanted also..
whats so unstable abouyt 11.10 for you?
i wanted it to hold 2 different ISO...so i can have 2 different live versions
you would have to reparton the thing and make a new ext4 partion to isntallto. then start up the installer  and install.
no its just my first time with linux and wanted to see if there was a differnce or get a copy with out unity to see how it works
for iso's theres guides on pendrivelinux, and tools that can help with that.
you could even set up your current install to just boot an ISO file as one of its grub entries..
that seems like it would be the easiest thing to do with the grub file. have any links supporting that?
delicious.com/dr_willis
that site http://delicious.com/dr_willis isnt loading anything....?
not my fault.. thats a rather big site.. its working here
hmmm, yeah bad internet over here. ill keep trying. thanks
